content.title: Intro
content.content:
1914
Preceded by
1914
1915
Year
1916
Followed by
1916

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1915.

content.title: March
content.content: ? - Earliest "evidence" of Tolkien working on "fairy language".

content.title: April
content.content: ? - J.R.R. Tolkien writes the poem Goblin Feet.

content.title: June
content.content:
10 - Exams start at Oxford University. Because of the war, only Tolkien and 24 others remain in the entire University. Tolkien passes.
28 - Tolkien applies at the Oxford recruiting office to join the army.
28 - Przemyslaw Mroczkowski, scholar and friend of J.R.R. Tolkien, is born.
? - Tolkien is awarded First Class Honours degree in English Language and Literature.

content.title: July
content.content: 15 - Tolkien is commissioned as a second lieutenant of the 13th Battalion Lancashire Fusiliers, and begins training at Bedford.

content.title: September
content.content: 25 - The Big Four of the T.C.B.S. - Tolkien, Smith, Wiseman and Gilson - have their last meeting.

content.title: November
content.content:
? - Tolkien writes his earliest version of The Trees of Kortirion.
21 - G.B. Smith is shipped to France.
26 - Tolkien writes Letter 3 with a copy of Kortirion to Edith Bratt from Rugeley Camp, Staffordshire.

content.title: December
content.content: ? - Tolkien might have written the poem Habbanan beneath the Stars.

? - The poem "Goblin Feet" is published in Oxford Poetry 1915.
Years
1912 1913 1914 1915 1916 1917 1918
